events.title: Fear Grips Muar as Enemy Air Raids Spark Mass Exodus
events.description: 349. The enemy's air offensive against Muar started on the 11th January. The bombing of the town, as in other places, started a general exodus and among those who left were the ferrymen, Nearly all the Asiatic employees of the waterworks and power station also deserted.

events.title: Brigade Blows Final Bridge in Kuala Lumpur; Advances to Labu After Strategic Demolitions
events.description: Arang area, followed the 28 Brigade Group through Kuala Lumpur. The last bridge in the Federal Capital was blown at 0430 hrs. 11th January and the Brigade, leaving a small force to cover further demohtions, moved to the Labu area west of Seremban.

events.title: German Air Force Launches Major Mediterranean Offensive: H.M.S. Illustrious Damaged, H.M.S. Southampton Sunk
events.description: 2. These operations marked the advent of the German Air Force in strength in the Mediterranean, and included the damaging of H.M.S. ILLUSTRIOUS on roth January and the loss of H.M.S. SOUTHAMPTON on 11th January.

events.title: Nation Braces for Change: A Momentous January Saturday in 1941
Surprise Dive Bombing Claims HMS SOUTHAMPTON in Shocking Attack on 3rd Cruiser Squadron
events.description: 7. The dive bombing attacks on the 3rd Cruiser Squadron on the afternoon of 11th January resulting in the loss of SOUTHAMPTON were a complete surprise, delivered at a time when the ships concerned believed themselves to have drawn clear of the threat of

events.title: Fierce Fighting on Djebel Azzag: Infantry Brigade Withdraws After Heavy Losses Amidst Relentless Rain
events.description: Meanwhile, on 3rd January, an attack by 36 Infantry Brigade to capture the dominating enemy positions on Djebel Azzag and Djebel Ajred was not  very successful and by 5th January after severe fighting in heavy rain, we withdrew to our original front. Losses on both sides were relatively heavy. Again on 3rd January 6 Armoured Division made a reconnaissance in force in the Goubellat plain; and on 11th January followed this by a successful local attack north of Bou Arada.

events.title: Japanese Troop Concentration Near Myawaddy Raises Alarm as Reports Confirm 5,000 Strong Forces
events.description: 68. Enemy Activities. During the early days of January many reports were received indicating that the Japanese were concentrating in some strength between Raheng and the frontier at Myawaddy, and on the 11th January the total was given as 5,000 in this area.
